intro: Lachnocaulon engleri var. caulescens, commonly known as the slender lachnocaulon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in shaded garden environments.
